page.title: 08Memories of World War I
page.content: As she did her house work and looked after her sick father-in-law she'd hope and pray for her husbands safety. Today was special,she had received a letter from him containing some wild pansies gathered from a French hedgerow.He said that the shell and gunfire and sights of death and blood shed were too horrible to write about. He was very tired with the strain of being in the front-line.Her husband took part in front-line night patrols and recorded in his diary how his platoon was caught in Verey lights flares,but escaped machine gun fire by lying flat on the ground.Later she was to learn that he had been wounded and captured.He luckily escaped death when the bible in his breast pocket stopped a piece of shrapnel penetrating his chest.He spent the rest of the war in a prison camp.
